verses.roman:
bāhuṣu chidyamāneṣu
bāṇasya bhagavān bhavaḥ
bhaktānakampy upavrajya
cakrāyudham abhāṣata

synonyms: bāhuṣu—the arms; chidyamāneṣu—as they were being severed; bāṇasya—of Bāṇāsura; bhagavān bhavaḥ—the great Lord Śiva; bhakta—toward his devotee; anukampī—compassionate; upavrajya—approaching; cakra-āyudham—to Lord Kṛṣṇa, wielder of the disc weapon; abhāṣata—he spoke.
translation: Lord Śiva felt compassion for his devotee Bāṇāsura, whose arms were being cut off, and thus he approached Lord Cakrāyudha [Kṛṣṇa] and spoke to Him as follows.
